meanings.definition: Extremely unpleasant or disagreeable in smell or taste.
meanings.sent1: The garbage left in the hot sun was the foulest thing I had ever smelled.
meanings.sent2: The dumpster behind the restaurant had the foulest odor imaginable.
meanings.sent3: The foulest smell from the old socks made everyone in the room laugh.
meanings.sent4: The stench in the alley was so foul, it was the foulest thing I could compare it to.
meanings.sent5: The foulest taste of the spoiled milk lingered in my mouth for hours.

meanings.sent1: The criminal's foulest deeds shocked the entire town.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's actions were considered the foulest acts of cruelty.
meanings.sent3: Despite his foulest behavior, he somehow managed to charm his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The foulest intentions lurked behind his innocent smile.
meanings.sent5: The foulest lies spun by the politician were eventually exposed.

meanings.sent1: After the storm, the streets were the foulest they had ever been.
meanings.sent2: The foulest language was used during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The foulest weather ruined our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The foulest mood settled over the group as they realized they were lost.
meanings.sent5: The foulest behavior at the party led to chaos and confusion.
